Let's find the pattern that connects each number.

$3\overset{\blueD?}{{\rightarrow}}6\overset{\blueD?}{\rightarrow} ~12 \overset{\blueD?}{\rightarrow} \goldD?\overset{\blueD?}{{\rightarrow}}48 \overset{\blueD?}{{\rightarrow}}96$

The pattern is to start at $3$ and multiply by $2$ each time.

$3\overset{\blueD{\times2}}{{\rightarrow}}6\overset{\blueD{\times2}}{\rightarrow} ~12 \overset{\blueD{\times2}}{\rightarrow} \goldD?\overset{\blueD{\times2}}{{\rightarrow}}48 \overset{\blueD{\times2}}{{\rightarrow}}96$

To find the missing number, we need to $\blueD{\text{multiply 2}}$ and $12$. 

$3{{\rightarrow}}6{\rightarrow} ~{12}\overset{\blueD{\times2}}{\rightarrow} \goldD{24}{{\rightarrow}}48 {{\rightarrow}}96$
The expression that helps us find the missing number is $12\times2$.
